turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Self-hating Jew.
turn.1: What is meant by self-hating jew?
turn.2: Self-hating Jew Self-hating Jew or self-loathing Jew (also Auto-Antisemitism) is a pejorative term used for a Jew who is alleged to hold antisemitic views.
turn.3: When did the term come about?
turn.4: Although similar accusations of being uncomfortable with one's Jewishness were already being made by groups of Jews against one another before Zionism existed as a movement, the concept gained widespread currency after Theodor Lessing's 1930 book ("Jewish Self-hatred"), which tried to explain the prevalence of Jewish intellectuals inciting antisemitism with their views toward Judaism.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The term became "something of a key term of opprobrium in and beyond Cold War-era debates about Zionism".
turn.7: Is the term still used today?
turn.8: The expression "self-hating Jew" is often used rhetorically to discount Jews who differ in their lifestyles, interests or political positions from their accusers.
turn.9: Is there any controversy on the term?
turn.10: Finlay, a member of the Psychology Department at University of Surrey, distinguishes between "Jewish antisemitism" and "Jewish self-hatred", arguing that while the literature is full of examples of Jews who espoused antisemitism with statements dangerous and damning to all Jews, "whether this amounts to self-hatred is not easy to assess.
turn.11: What else does the term mean?
turn.12: " Usage of self-hatred can also designate dislike or hatred of a group to which one belongs.
